bill_title: prohibit the driving of a vehicle after the illegal consumption of any amount of an illegal controlled drug or substance.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the driving of a vehicle after the illegal consumption of any amount of an illegal controlled drug or substance. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-23 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may drive or be in actual physical control of any vehicle after the consumption, ingestion, or inhalation of any controlled drug or substance, as defined in subdivision 22-42-1(1), for so long as any discernable trace remains in the person's blood, tissue, or respiratory system. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 32-23 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: It is a defense to any prosecution pursuant to section 1 of this Act that the accused consumed or otherwise took the controlled drug or substance under a valid prescription, or upon order or advice of a licensed physician, or by other lawful manner. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
